channel.title: computers on GrooveStomp
channel.description: Recent content in computers on GrooveStomp

item.title: Game Reviews, OSes and the 3DS
item.description: Today is a grab-bag of miscellaneous thoughts and updates that aren’t necessarily related to each other. First off, I haven’t been keeping up with my daily programming practice, but it’s not for lack of will. As my last post may have illustrated 1; I’ve been dealing with computer problems. I’ve only recently managed to get a working installation of Windows on my machine, but I’ve run into problems with my GNU/Linux distro, so actual productivity work is put on hold until that’s resolved.

item.title: UEFI and Windows 10
item.description: My primary desktop environment is some variant of GNU/Linux. The only case where this hasn’t been true is when I was really into PC gaming and was operating off of Windows 7 for that purpose. Recently I’ve been more interested in privacy. One nice thing you can do several modern GNU/Linux distributions is full disk encryption (FDE). I’ve been using this where possible for over two years now. Unfortunately, FDE requires the GNU/Linux distro to completely take over your HDD.
